publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5597 Richard Lochhead: Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray—That the Parliament warmly welcomes Diageo’s announcement that it is investing £100 million to expand its Scotch whisky operations in Scotland; is delighted to note that these plans include a proposal to build a new malt whisky distillery in Roseisle in Moray; recognises that this announcement signals the enormous success of the iconic Scotch whisky industry which is benefiting from expanding overseas markets; appreciates that the prospect of new distilleries opening locally illustrates the growing confidence in Moray’s international reputation as the home of malt whisky distilling, and calls for continuing cross-party support for an industry that makes a huge contribution to the Scottish economy. Supported by: Bruce Crawford*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*

S2M-5597 Richard Lochhead: Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray—That the Parliament warmly welcomes Diageo’s announcement that it is investing £100 million to expand its Scotch whisky operations in Scotland; is delighted to note that these plans include a proposal to build a new malt whisky distillery in Roseisle in Moray; recognises that this announcement signals the enormous success of the iconic Scotch whisky industry which is benefiting from expanding overseas markets; appreciates that the prospect of new distilleries opening locally illustrates the growing confidence in Moray’s international reputation as the home of malt whisky distilling, and calls for continuing cross-party support for an industry that makes a huge contribution to the Scottish economy. Supported by: Bruce Crawford, Rob Gibson, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Ms Maureen Watt*
S2M-5597 Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray (lodged on 15 February 2007) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5597 Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray (lodged on 15 February 2007) Margaret Smith*, Michael Matheson*
S2M-5597 Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray (lodged on 15 February 2007) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Jim Mather*, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-5597 Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray (lodged on 15 February 2007) Mr Jamie Stone*, Derek Brownlee*
S2M-5597 Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray (lodged on 15 February 2007) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-5597 Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray (lodged on 15 February 2007) Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-5597 Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray (lodged on 15 February 2007) Peter Peacock*

S2M-5597 Richard Lochhead: Diageo’s Proposal for New Malt Whisky Distillery in Moray—That the Parliament warmly welcomes Diageo’s announcement that it is investing £100 million to expand its Scotch whisky operations in Scotland; is delighted to note that these plans include a proposal to build a new malt whisky distillery in Roseisle in Moray; recognises that this announcement signals the enormous success of the iconic Scotch whisky industry which is benefiting from expanding overseas markets; appreciates that the prospect of new distilleries opening locally illustrates the growing confidence in Moray’s international reputation as the home of malt whisky distilling, and calls for continuing cross-party support for an industry that makes a huge contribution to the Scottish economy. Supported by: Bruce Crawford, Rob Gibson, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Ms Maureen Watt, Donald Gorrie, Mr Adam Ingram, Margaret Smith, Michael Matheson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Jim Mather, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Jamie Stone, Derek Brownlee, Eleanor Scott, Mrs Nanette Milne, Peter Peacock
